intro: Macrosolen urceolatus, commonly known as the urn-shaped liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a non-vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions. The plant has a distinctive morphology characterized by its cup-like thallus, which gives it its common name. It lacks true roots, stems, and leaves, instead having a flat, leafy structure known as a thallus. Macrosolen urceolatus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for small invertebrates in its ecosystem.
